snippet: The United States Sentencing Commission had proposed changing federal guidelines to lessen the average sentence for drug dealers by about one year, to 51 months from 62 months.
abstract: Atty Gen Eric H Holder Jr is endorsing proposal that would reduce prison sentences for people convicted of dealing drugs, latest sign of Obama administration's retrenchment in the so-called war on drugs; United States Sentencing Commission had proposed changing federal guidelines to lessen average sentence by about one year, to 51 months from 62 months.
lead_paragraph: The United States Sentencing Commission had proposed changing federal guidelines to lessen the average sentence for drug dealers by about one year, to 51 months from 62 months.

headline.main: Holder Endorses Proposal to Reduce Drug Sentences in Latest Sign of Shift
headline.print_headline: Holder Backs Proposal to Reduce Drug Sentences
